paper_abstract: Chip type passive components (e g resistors, capacitors and inductors), owing to their excellent electronic properties, ate widely used in the design of high density PC boards The excellences of the chip-type components ate accomplished through rigorous controlling of every production step, especially the accuracy demanding chip dicing operation This research develops a machine vision system to find mass centers of chips, locate cutting lines and estimate process regulation plans for the automated, precise, and high-speed dicing of the chip type components The radial basis function (RBF) network and the engineering process control (EPC) method with response surface methodology are proposed to model the dicing deviations, and to timely and quantitatively regulate the process towards the target values Experimental results show that the proposed process regulation approaches significantly outperform the current dicing method in adjustment performance
paper_title: RBF NETWORK AND EPC METHOD APPLIED TO AUTOMATED PROCESS REGULATIONS FOR PASSIVE COMPONENTS DICING
